title: 114_hr2923
content: The Act is titled the "Maritime and Energy Workforce Technical Training Enhancement Act" and aims to enhance technical training for the maritime and energy workforce. The Secretary of Energy will award grants to community colleges and public institutions of higher education to expand maritime and energy workforce technical training programs, including admitting more students, training faculty, and creating new career pathways. The Secretary may award grants to nonprofit organizations with expertise in workforce development programs for community colleges. Priority will be given to institutions partnering with specific government departments. Grants will range from $1,000,000 to $1,500,000. The Secretary will issue requests for proposals from eligible institutions for grants ranging from $1,000,000 to $1,500,000 annually for 2 years. Institutions seeking grants must demonstrate willingness to participate in partnerships and maintain maritime and energy workforce technical abilities. The eligible institution awarded a grant under this section shall use grant amounts for training related to maritime or energy transportation, shipbuilding, academic and workforce training programs enhancement, salary supplementation for faculty, and operation and maintenance of maritime or energy facilities. The eligible institution awarded a grant under this section can use the funds for various purposes such as operation and maintenance of maritime or energy equipment, acquisition of vessels and safety equipment, renovation or construction of buildings for training programs, and tuition reimbursement for completing maritime or energy courses. An eligible institution awarded a grant under this section can use up to 50% of the funds for paragraph (1)(G), give admissions preference to veterans in maritime or energy programs, and utilize the grant funds for three years. Eligible institutions are defined as those near marine or port facilities in specific regions. The program offers maritime training and education near marine or port facilities in specific regions, with associations with government agencies. Veterans are given admissions preference, and $12,000,000 is authorized for fiscal years 2016-2018. Centers of Excellence in Maritime and Energy Workforce Technical Training are established with admissions preference for veterans and $12,000,000 authorized for fiscal years 2016-2018. The Secretary will award grants to eligible institutions to establish Centers of Excellence in Maritime and Energy Workforce Technical Training, improving training opportunities for veterans, Armed Forces members, Federal employees, and civilians in areas such as port transportation systems and logistics. The Secretary will prioritize grants for eligible institutions that offer training in maritime and energy logistics, small vessel repair, navigation systems maintenance, port transportation, shipbuilding, and job placement in related fields. Eligible institutions must have agreements with government agencies or private sector entities to provide resources or assistance for maritime training capacity. Grants awarded under this section will prioritize training in maritime and energy logistics, small vessel repair, navigation systems maintenance, port transportation, shipbuilding, and job placement. Eligible institutions can receive grants of up to $1,500,000 per Center for maritime and energy training and education. The Secretary will issue a request for proposals within 90 days of the Act's enactment, and institutions must submit applications with required information. Grant recipients must use the funds to develop an agenda for maritime and energy training. The section outlines the use of funds for maritime and energy training and education at eligible institutions located near marine facilities. Grants can be used for expansion, publishing findings, and operating training programs for a period of five years. Eligible institutions must have existing workforce training programs. The workforce training program offers accredited programs in academic areas such as port related transportation, logistics, supply chain management, shipbuilding, and ship repair. It is well recognized in the field of maritime workforce training and has established associations with government agencies like the Department of Energy, Department of Defense, Department of Homeland Security, Department of Transportation, Department of Veterans Affairs, and port authorities. The term "veteran" is defined in section 101 of title 38, United States Code. $12,000,000 is authorized for fiscal years 2016, 2017, and 2018 for the Secretary to carry out this section.
